title: Why Gaza keeps losing communications
description: Gaza’s cellphone network had struggled before the conflict. Now it’s failing as people are trying to connect with loved ones and secure resources.

title: The U.S., Yemen and the risk of regional escalation
description: After the Biden administration launched airstrikes against Houthi fighters in Yemen, the group attacked a U.S. cargo carrier. U.S. officials say that their operations are limited and that they do not want to be drawn into a larger conflict, but is that possible?

title: U.S. strikes Yemen again as campaign to thwart Houthis intensifies
description: The strikes in Yemen mark at least the third time in the last week that the U.S. military has targeted Iran-backed Houthi militants.

title: World’s first trillionaire may emerge in 10 years, disparity report finds
description: Antipoverty group Oxfam said the world’s five richest people have almost doubled their wealth since 2019, while nearly 5 billion people have become poorer.

title: Iran extends sentence of Nobel laureate who defended women’s rights
description: Narges Mohammadi’s sentences total more than 12 years in prison and 154 lashes. The Nobel Peace Prize winner supported feminist protests.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: Iran attacks alleged Israeli spy site in Iraq; Houthis strike U.S. container ship
description: Iran’s Revolutionary Guard Corps said it attacked a site belonging to Israel’s Mossad intelligence agency in a populous part of Iraq’s Kurdistan region.

title: Iran says its missiles struck Israeli spy site in Iraq’s Kurdistan region
description: U.S. and Kurdish officials condemned the strike, which Reuters reported was near the U.S. consulate and which local authorities said killed four people.

title: Russian air passengers face peril as planes show strain of sanctions
description: A series of harrowing air safety incidents has forced numerous emergency landings of airliners across Russia, leaving passengers screaming — in anger or fear.

title: ‘Israel’s SNL’ provides much-needed laughs to a traumatized nation
description: Politicians, media figures and hostages are fair game on Eretz Nehederet, Israel’s most popular sketch comedy show — but criticism of the war in Gaza is off-limits.

title: What Yemen’s Houthis gain through their Red Sea strikes
description: Analysts contend that this new phase of U.S.-led military coalition attacks on Houthi militants may strengthen, rather than weaken them.

title: U.S. forces recovered Iranian warheads in Navy SEAL mission gone awry
description: The Pentagon suspects the Iranian arms shipment, intercepted off Somalia, was destined for militants in Yemen blamed for attacking ships in the Red Sea.
